title: FLOAT BBS Zine Explorer
description: A retro BBS-inspired interface for exploring digital zines and philosophical concepts through the FLOAT framework.

fullDescription.content: FLOAT BBS Zine Explorer is a nostalgic yet forward-thinking digital space that reimagines the classic Bulletin Board System (BBS) interface as a tool for exploring philosophical concepts, digital zines, and experimental thought frameworks.
FLOAT: Feedback Loops of Affective Transformation

At the core of this project is FLOAT - a speculative digital framework blending psychoanalytic theory, queer theory, computational concepts, and philosophical frameworks. It serves as both a personal knowledge management system and a conceptual exploration tool.

items.title: Shacks not Cathedrals
items.content: Choose lightweight, adaptable cognitive structures over rigid complex systems

items.title: Emotional Resonance as Data
items.content: Truth is validated through affective resonance

fullDescription.content: The project features a deliberately retro interface that evokes the aesthetic of early 1990s BBS systems, complete with terminal-style text, neon colors against a black background, and command-line interactions. This nostalgic design choice creates a unique space for exploring forward-thinking concepts through a lens of digital history.

screenshots.alt: FLOAT BBS interface showing the terminal with core principles and navigation options
